title: How to Make an Origami Chair

steps.headline: Start with a six inch square piece of paper.
steps.description: Lay it with the colored side facing down. Fold it in half hot-dog style (there should be two long sides) and crease well.

steps.headline: Fold the right and left side so they meet at the middle crease, and crease them well.
The paper should be divided into four equal parts.
steps.description: Cut off one of the parts.

steps.headline: Fold the paper the other way, and crease well.
Fold the top right corner to meet the first vertical line and crease well.
Repeat the previous step for the left corner.
Do a squash fold.
steps.description: Starting with the right corner, unfold the crease you just made. Open it slightly and then squash it down to form a triangle.

steps.headline: Repeat the last step for the left corner.
Fold the center flap up to meet the top edge.
Fold the right side to the left.
Fold the left side to the right, crease and unfold.

text: Start with a six inch square piece of paper. Lay it with the colored side facing down. Fold it in half hot-dog style (there should be two long sides) and crease well. Fold the right and left side so they meet at the middle crease, and crease them well.  The paper should be divided into four equal parts. Cut off one of the parts. Fold the paper the other way, and crease well.  Fold the top right corner to meet the first vertical line and crease well.  Repeat the previous step for the left corner.  Do a squash fold. Starting with the right corner, unfold the crease you just made. Open it slightly and then squash it down to form a triangle. Repeat the last step for the left corner.  Fold the center flap up to meet the top edge.  Fold the right side to the left. Crease well and unfold. Fold the left side to the right, crease and unfold.  Bring the top flap down. Tape or glue it. And that's it! Enjoy your origami chair.
